translated: Elder’s Birth Stories🔽The Chapter about the Giver of the World

analyzed: a kkamana dāya katthera a padāna

translated: to the brahmin who was accomplished,

analyzed: divāvihāram vajataḥ  akkamanamadāsaha  imasmiyā iva kappamhi
translated: when he was going to the day-time dwelling,🔽I gave a place to walk on.🔽In this very life,
I do not know of a bad destination,
this is the fruit of giving a place to walk on.
My defilements have been burned up,
Welcome indeed it was for me,
I have done what the Awakened One said.
I have done what the Awakened One said.”🔽Thus the elder Akkamanadāyaka recited these verses.

original: Itthaṁ sudaṁ āyasmā akkamanadāyako thero imā gāthāyo abhāsitthāti.🔽Akkamanadāyakattherassāpadānaṁ pañcamaṁ.
analyzed: ittham sudam āyasmai akkamanadāyakaḥ theraḥ imāḥ gāthāyaḥ abhāsittha ati 🔽akkamana dāyaka therassa apadānam pañcama
translated: The Elder Akkamanadāyaka’s Birth Story, the fifth.
